title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 323.3 - Notification that deposits are uninsured
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 323.3 - Notification that deposits are uninsured

State Regulations

At or prior to the time a licensed agency of a foreign bank
shall open any deposit account under $100,000 for a depositor not a citizen or
resident of the United States, pursuant to section
202-a
(1)(c)
of the Banking Law, and this Part, it
shall notify the depositor that the agency's deposits are not insured by the
FDIC. Such notification shall be in writing and shall appear in a conspicuous
place on the signature card or other related documentation pertaining to the
opening of the account. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
323.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
